description: From forgive +‎ -able. Partially displaced non-native Middle English pardonable (“capable of being pardoned, forgivable”) from Old French pardonable (“forgivable”).

adjectives.description: forgivable (comparative more forgivable, superlative most forgivable)

entries.meaning: Able to be forgiven; worthy of forgiveness.
(finance, not comparable) Of a loan, or a portion of it: such that repayment may be deferred for a period if the lender meets certain obligations.
